comment: Bandaids on the nose. Corn mixed with medicinal flavors on the tongue. Light sweetness.  Certainly not my favorite bourbon. 3.45.

Tried this at the whisky extravaganza. Currently single barrel but will soon become small batch due to Widow Jane's growth being too big to handle single barrel inconsistencies. This has notes of spices, stone fruits, caramel, vanilla, and corn.
Solid bourbon but WAY too pricey.
Hot short finish... Can taste the limestone. Pretty cool. Peppery and sweet
Sweet fruit on the palate with caramel finish, an absolute favorite of mine.
Surprisingly good.  Full of spice without being hot.  Big Red gum all the way.  A nice friend shared some with me. I don't know how much the bottle would be,  but I definitely suggest getting a pour.
Light and a touch of caramel.
Didn't like it. I wouldn't purchase again.
Nicely done. Sweet but not overly. Has the caramel and vanilla notes expected. Light taste of oak. Not hot or spicy at all to me. Straight, no mixer, one cube, good to go.
Smooth finish. No burn. Caramel hints. Love this!

Cinnamon spice highlights the fairly powerful nose.  On the palate, you get a light touch of spice and limestone, pastry dough and toffee.  Ultimately, it’s good, but it’s not complex , is light in mouthfeel and the finish is short.

Caramel and sweet forward, clean finish with just enough burn to remind you that this is something that you should appreciate. I don't have the palate to say that the mineral water is what gives this such appeal to me (I grew up in South Jersey drinking hard water with a high iron content), but I will never turn this down.

Tasted neat. Only neat. I would drink it with a straw if I wouldn't go through it too quickly.
Lots of oak, tons of spice and cinnamon, a hint of cherry and vanilla. I really enjoy the amount of oak I’m getting in this.

Nose: stone fruits, honey and spice. 
Taste: sweet, very well rounded, cocoa, baking spices, medium long finish. 

Wife bought it for me for Valentine’s Day and I think she found a gem. Forget the MGP critics, this is a very fine bourbon.

Very fruity nose; berries, peach, possibly a bit of tropical fruit like kiwi and banana, fresh tomato, browned butter, burnt sugar, vanilla, delicately floral. The flavor is very subtle, delicate; hay, caramel, red ground pepper. Peppery finish, slightly floral once again, a long burn.
Very tasty and sweet. This is one I’m going to find the bottle to take home.
Cherry overtones with a smooth finish
Oak and cherry overtones, a strong start with a smooth finish
Smells like toasted marshmallows and black licorice with hints of oak and vanilla. High rye taste with lots of pepper
Sweet, briney nose. Flavor makes me think this is a high rye bourbon. I get a burnt sugar taste, but also a distinctive rye/clove flavor. Overall, very mild.
Liking it more and more as I sippy dippy. Kinda Stagg Jr light.

I’m not a big bourbon guy, I prefer scotch, but I really enjoy this bourbon. It’s slick and sweet, yummy and fun on a Tuesday after dinner. PS after having a bit more of this deliciousness, I have upped my rating to 4.0 stars. Yum.
Very smooth and tasty.  This is now one of my favorites
very smooth, mellows fast, slight fruitiness not to be overpowering by that flavor.
This is a better bourbon. Very smooth, almost syrupy and sweet with vanilla and caramel. I enjoyed this with my wife and son on a quiet stay-at-home Saturday night.

The nose is oak forward along with cherry, cinnamon, vanilla, molasses and a hint of leather. The palate is rich and oaky with creamy vanilla, cinnamon, cherry syrup and cooked brown sugar. The finish is medium long with fading oak, cinnamon and cooked vanilla.
Solid bourbon. Full flavored, brown sugar and marshmallow.
2oz pour neat in Glencairn at Breezy's.  Batch 112, Bottle 57, year 2019.  Tons of spices, brown sugar, toffee, mild vanilla.  This is really good stuff.  9/19/19

Batch 111: This is a nicely done smooth bourbon. Noticeable oak, vanilla and caramels on the nose. The taste is exactly as I would expect for a good 10 year bourbon. I would definitely recommend getting this one.

Nose: Brown sugar, ginger, campfire smoke, touch of mint
Palate: Oak, licorice, milk chocolate, corn.  Marzipan finish
Very enjoyable Whiskey. I have had this a number of times and enjoy it every time. I seem to get in trouble with this each time I drink it :-). Very well balanced.
Good flavor. Sort of lacking a body.

Tasted 10/17/19

Been wanting to try this for awhile, but was a little uncertain because of the price. The nose really remind me of a Canadian rye with the pallet being a big vanilla bomb. The finish is medium long and it has a nice oakyness.
The initial taste is very fruit forward, giving way to caramel and oak. Medium finish
Quick tingly spice on the tongue, nice flavors but a lingering dry bitterness afterwards
I drank this bottle before I became interested in all the subtleties of different bourbons.  I will say that I liked it and thought it was very good.
Little too sweet and fruity up front. Finishes smooth.
A bit of bite that lingers just a little too long. Flavor is nice. The one I am trying is 10 yr., Cask 1785, bottled 2018
Vanilla and oak, quite sweet. Persimmon
Great nose, nice finish, warm, lovely
Cherry and other stone fruit flavours come forward along with silky, oaky notes. Burnt caramel mid palate, medium finish.

Sweet nose, smooth, warm. Delightful

Batch 134 bottle 795
Good drinking bourbon. Very smooth. Lacks the character of some of your higher end bourbons.
Lacking much fragrance it is surprisingly smooth. Good drinking bourbon but lacks some of the character top bourbons have.

Back to NY. My last NY whiskey review was over ago. That was of the Hudson Baby Bourbon. Was not a fan by any means. Let's see if the Empire state can redeem itself with this one.

Nose: Classic bourbon notes. Caramel and vanilla. Apple and black cherry. Honey and butterscotch. A touch of leather, barrel char, and oak. Maple and pecan. It's rich and vibrant, and is an exemplary classic bourbon nose. Good start.

Palate: Gala apple and brown sugar out of the gate. More caramel, vanilla, and butterscotch, now accompanied by toffee. In the background I still get black cherry, with just a hint of leather. Orange peel and ginger become prominent with time.

Finish: Long, especially for 45.5%. Cinnamon, clove, and nutmeg. Finally, a bit of a kick. Until now it's been perfectly easy-going. Some barrel char and oak. There's also a bit of brown sugar sweetness before baking spices and ginger carry this one to its long-drawn conclusion.

New York, you are redeemed. Excellent bourbon. As I said before, it's an exemplary classic bourbon. Both in terms of notes and quality. There's also something unique about it. The folks at Widow Jane would tell you it's a product of their limestone mineral water. I'm in no position to comment, but I'll just throw it out there: there's something special going on here.

Highly recommend this one. The palate is a slight letdown in comparison to the superb nose and finish. Just a half step behind. On the other hand, it boasts a 10-year age statement, repsectable proof, and a unique spin on what is, for the most part, a quintessential bourbon profile. Well done, Widow Jane.
Smooth and balanced, with some complexity on the back end.
Vanilla and butter. Complex rye like finish
Sweet roasted Carmel flavors finish dark and smooth.  Reminds me of figs and aged fruit. The alcohol content doesn't feel too high.  Noses fruity with burnt sugar.
Warm, sweet and smooth. Nice neat sippin bourbon
I really love the balance of this Bourbon. There is sweet and smoke and spice but not to much of any. This is my second time tasting and I think I need a bottle.
91 proof. Very good. Much less wordiness than Jack. Smooth. Nice flavor
Smooth and sweet - very nice.  Could get in trouble with this one.

1 ice cube
Nose: good, caramel nose. Sweet Cheerios with some sweet fruit, cherries maybe. 
Palate: good complexity, oak wood carries, mild to moderate spice, mid length finish, black cherries or cinnamon apple pie. Super smooth.
Smooth and creamy, slightly sweet. Not complex and easy sipping. Fine for after dinner and for those that do, enjoy it with the cigar of your choice.
Above average and worth the try.

Good bourbon, I use it in Manhattans, it is a little to strong for my liking, but in a mixed drink it smooths out and is worth the purchase.  Stronger flavor profile.  Not my favorite, but worth a try.
Very smooth 45% blend. Soft and woody with a leather and brown sugar finish. Light and very drinkable neat.  Love the nose of dried fruit.
See this around frequently, nice to give it a try.  Good balance of heat, spice and flavor.  Like that the flavor doesn’t disappear quickly.  The more I sipped the more I enjoyed, surprising!

Tasted neat in a rocks. Butterscotch hard candy on the nose.

Oh my. This is warm, sweet, & easy on the pallet. Very delicate. My wife who is not a brown liquor fan but knows good stuff from bad pretty damn quick, immediately approved. Super approachable! 

There's good measure of vanilla and almond, bit'o honey candy and a slight touch of ginger and white pepper on the finish. 

Immensely enjoyable!
I get nothing but cherry NyQuil from this one.🙁
not too complex, but solid enough to be enjoyable. definitely worth a look & your money.
Complex nose with rich notes of caramel, toffee, and oak. Hot and spicy up front, with sweet and vanilla after-tones and a smooth finish.
Smokey in all the right ways.
